nodes.bodyText: we don't need this as well right? I think that will be handled in SignedJWT.parse()

This part should go into SignedJWTInfo. So SignedJWTInfo has a constructor which accepts a string constructor. Inside it the the signedJWT is created. Then while calling to SignedJWTInfo.getClaimSet method, the getClaimSet method of the signedJWT is called and resulting claims are cached at the SignedJWTInfo layer. getClaimSet is not called prematurely but only when it's needed. And the ClaimSet is saved for subsequent calls.
Repeating block. Better move this to SignedJWTInfo class as mentioned in the previous comment.
Change this to check for stored jwtClaimsSet and compute if absent.
